name: Refinery Platform
body: ### About The Refinery Platform is a web-based data visualization and analysis system powered by an ISA-Tab-compatible data repository for public and private data sets. Analyses are implemented as Galaxy workflows and executed through the Galaxy API. ### Talks and Presentations * __Refinery Platform - Integrating Visualization and Analysis of Large-Scale Biological Data__, _Bioinformatics Open Source Conference 2013_, Berlin, Germany, July 2013. [[Slides](http://gehlenborg.com/wp-content/uploads/nils-gehlenborg_bosc2013-refinery.pdf)] * __An exemplar for data integration in the biomedical domain driven by the ISA framework__, _AMIA Joint Summits on Translational Science 2013_, San Francisco, USA, March 2013. * __Visualization and Analysis of Large (Epi)Genomics Data Sets with Refinery__, _Understanding Cancer Genomics Through Information Visualization Symposium_, Tokyo, Japan, February 2013. [[Slides](http://gehlenborg.com/wp-content/uploads/nils-gehlenborg_infovis-and-cancer-symposium_refinery-talk.pdf)] * __Connecting Galaxy to a Data Repository__, _Galaxy Community Conference 2012_, Chicago, IL, USA, July 2012. [[Slides](http://wiki.galaxyproject.org/Documents/Presentations/GCC2012?action=AttachFile&do=view&target=Park.pdf)] * __The Refinery Platform for Analysis and Visualization of Biomedical Genomics Data__, _Center for Biomedical Informatics & Countway Library Symposium_, Boston, MA, USA, May 2012. [[Video](http://player.vimeo.com/video/43929942)] ### Projects using the Refinery Platform - http://encode-x.med.harvard.edu | This is a site running the Refinery Platform in "repository mode". In repository mode workflows cannot be accessed. - http://www.stemcellcommons.org | The Refinery Platform will provide data manipulation, analysis and visualization capabilities for the Stem Cell Commons project (under development). ### Documentation Our documentation for Refinery Platform users, administrators and developers is available at http://refinery-platform.readthedocs.org. This is work in progress. ### Project Team The Refinery Platform is a project of the Park Lab at Harvard Medical School in collaboration with the Hide Lab at Harvard School of Public Health. #### Park Lab * Nils Gehlenborg (@ngehlenborg) * Richard Park (@rpark37) * Psalm Haseley (@psm3426) * Peter J Park #### Hide Lab * Ilya Sytchev (@hackdna) * Shannan Ho Sui (@sjhosui) * Winston Hide ### Funding The project is funded in part by an [Agilent Technologies Emerging Insights Grant](https://www.chem.agilent.com/en-US/promotions/pages/grant2.aspx) to Peter Park. ### Contact and Support Please create a ticket in the issue tracker or email us at refinery@hms.harvard.edu.
